content: quick and sturdy dryer balls a crochet pattern by jamie bennett wool dryer balls are a wonderfully simple way to make your electric clothes dryer more efficient while reducing static and eliminating the need for dryer sheets and fabric softener they are simple and quick to make are super for stash-busting yarn leftover from other wool projects and they make wonderful gifts materials bulky weight 100% wool yarn not superwash may use worsted weight held double but may need to go up a hook size 6 50mm k/10 5 crochet hook tapestry or yarn needle gauge gauge isn t vital to this project but approximately 2 sts and 1 3 rounds per inch yardage each ball uses about 35g of yarn abbreviations single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet decrease = single_crochet two together directions part one inside of ball the inside of the ball is made by winding yarn into a ball that is a bit smaller than you wish your finished ball to be i like mine to be about 6-7 inches in circumference before felting make sure that the yarn is wrapped snuggly around the outside so that it is easier to fit it inside the outer shell cut yarn part two crochet shell set up make a magic_ring and cast on 7 single_crochet pull tail to tighten magic_ring you will be working in the round in a spiral note you might find it helpful to place a stitch marker to denote the first stitch of the round round 1 2 half_double_crochet in every single_crochet all the way around 14 single_crochet rounds 2 - 7 1 half_double_crochet in each half_double_crochet of previous round 14 half_double_crochet each round take the ball of wound yarn and stuff it inside the pouch you ve made if your ball is a bit tall for this pouch to close you have two options a unwind some of the ball to make it smaller or b do 1 more round of half_double_crochet before moving onto round 8 round 8 decrease all the way around 7 single_crochet remain finishing cut yarn leaving a 6 inch tail and fasten_off by drawing through the loop of the final single crochet weave the tail through the tops of the single crochets of the final round and pull tight to close pass the needle and yarn in and through the ball repeatedly until the tail is so short that you cannot do so again trim remaining tail make as many as you would like to use i like to use 4 at a time they can be used as is but will hold up longer if you felt them felting put the balls in the washer with some towels and/or old jeans and run on a hot cycle sometimes some yarns want this to be done twice for the best felting then run everything through the dryer and they are done
